meanings.definition: Inflated or pretentious writing or speech
meanings.sent1: The politician's speech was full of fustian, trying to impress without real substance.
meanings.sent2: The author's fustian in the novel made it difficult to follow the main point.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's fustian about the importance of pencil sharpeners made the students giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her fustian of grandeur was like a balloon ready to burst with hot air.
meanings.sent5: The fustian of his promises faded quickly when reality set in.

meanings.definition: A thick, durable twilled cloth made of cotton and flax
meanings.sent1: She sewed a sturdy apron from fustian to use in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The tailor recommended fustian for the work pants due to its durability.
meanings.sent3: The fustian fabric kept the cold wind at bay during the winter.
meanings.sent4: The fustian material felt like a shield against wear and tear.
meanings.sent5: The fustian jacket was perfect for outdoor adventures.

meanings.sent1: The fustian at the party talked only about their expensive possessions.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the fustian at work who always boasted about their achievements.
meanings.sent3: The fustian strutted around as if they were the ruler of the world.
meanings.sent4: His fustian attitude made it hard for others to approach him.
meanings.sent5: The fustian's arrogance was as thick as the fustian fabric they wore.
